reviews.title: Confederation Place Hotel - a great spot
reviews.text: The Confederation Place Hotel had what we needed - 3 double beds in one room. This was what made me book there, but the overall experience was very pleasant - lovely staff and brilliant location. We stayed for 3 nights in one week, went off to Montreal and Ottawa, then rebooked for another three nights (Sept - Oct 2006). The location could not be better - downtown right near the fresh market, lots of restaurants, the waterfront, tourist information and only a few minutes walk from Queens.
The hotel had not been reviewed or highlighted when I was searching for places to stay. It is a bit of a hidden treasure.
reviews.title: Stay away at all costs !!!
stay clear of the restaurant!!
reviews.text: We passed some of the well-reviewed motels on the edge of town, but I was very glad that we found somewhere right in the old section and on the water. It meant we did not use our car at all unless going well outside Kingston.

reviews.title: This place is allowed to be open?
reviews.text: It's hard to believe that this dump of a hotel is not at the bottom of the list, there's actually 6 other hotels worse than this place ? Very hard to believe ? We compiled a list of things that were wrong with the place and wanted to talk to the manager. It's amazing that he became totally invisible to us, his secretary won't let you talk to him and he never answers his phone. And don't expect a return phone call from him, he's too busy hiding from everyone. This hotel is a total dump, do not waste your money by staying here. The only thing good enough for this hotel is to have is demolished. I'll be in line with a sledgehammer !

just a little tidbit if info for anybody looking for a good place to eat, DONT VISIT THE RESTAURANT AT HOJOS!! we were there on may 22 2005 hoping to get a good breakfast. we were seated and given coffee very quickly, we sat for over 20 minutes before anybody came to our table, it was clear that it was mass chaos in there, as the servers were bumping into each other and nobody seemed to know what they were supposed to do. our coffee being finished and a server coming to the table to fill our creamers we asked for another coffee. the reply was "we have a very slow coffee maker", we watched other servers going around with coffee and taking orders and still nothing, i thought we were invisible. another server saw the annoyance on our faces and took our order, 45 minutes later still no food and still not another cup of coffee, an hour later we left $4 on the table told the server we have never seen anything like this before and her reply was (extremely ingnorant) "well we're busy". we were going to book a room at the hotel but after treatment like that, we stayed very "comfort"ably at another motel. what a nightmare!!
reviews.title: Simply dreadful
Howard Johnson Has A Heart
reviews.text: The staff and management at the Howard Johnson are wonderful! Their warm and caring spirits are deeply appreciated. My husband and I travelled to the hotel from the U.S for several years in order to receive cancer treatment in Kingston. Often, my husband alone as I could not leave my job. The staff took care of him like he was one of the family. I never had to worry. Even the housekeepers would check up on him. Top marks to everyone from housekeeping to management!

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: Our family stayed at the Howard Johnson in Kingston and had the best time ever. The staff was friendly and helpful, our family suite was clean spacious and comfortable and the restaurant and patio was fabulous. Great location and excellent value.

reviews.title: Stay Clear!
reviews.text: Stay away from this hotel. We stayed for 2 days, September 2003. Cost $179Cdn/night. Room was disgusting. The carpet was so stained that we kept our socks on all the time. The power went out on one side of the room including the TV. After 3 complaints, it was not fixed until Sat evening. We sat in the dining room for breadfast for 15 min and no service! Overpriced, filthy room and poor service. Stay away!

reviews.title: Definitely a diappointment
reviews.text: There really was nothing about the HJ in Kingston that we were happy with except its location in the heart of Kingston. The 'suite' as they called it was nothing more than a conference room with a couch. We were told it would open onto the pool but in fact it opened onto a parking lot where the tour buses parked. The stucco ceiling in the room was falling apart in places and the air conditioner was noisy and barely kept the place below sweltering. After we finished (and paid for) breakfast the front desk clerk gave us coupons for free breakfast-no refunds though-. The room wasn't dirty but it smelled musty and stale.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Basically all this place has got going for it is the view - if you stay lakeside. If you arrive later than the minimum check-in time (3:00), don't expect to get parking in their underground lot, which will cost you $10 if you are so lucky. When I asked how many cars their lot held, the check-in clerk said, "Maybe 40 or 50". Parking in the municipal lot across the street might be an option for you if they are not full, but could run you upwards of $20 per night depending on how long you stay there. The only friendly service we got was from the night maid, who offered to let us stay later than closing time at the pool, and the morning maid, who asked us where we were from and wished us a nice day. Otherwise, customer service was dreadful! A mix-up when booking was not acknowledged with an apology, and both check-in and check-out experiences were underwhelming in terms of friendliness. The elevators are terribly shabby, the carpets in the halls were stained, and the room itself was far from pristine. Dark spots marked the floors, and the bathroom was very dated - with the shower head dangling off the wall by about 5 inches. Coffee mugs and glasses were not sealed for sanitary purposes, and the air conditioner barely coughed out any cool air at all. As well, in these times when one expects to find at least a Queen-sized bed in your room, this place has Doubles. The bed was, however, very comfortable, and the pillows were fluffy.
reviews.title: Think Twice ...

likes.disliked: — bad service and lack of pride in overall presentation

reviews.text: Bottom line: the view is the only thing that makes a stay here worth it - so long as you don't pay any more than $120 per night.
reviews.title: way over priced.

reviews.text: It would be so easy for management to fix up all the drawbacks to this place. Hopefully they'll see the light sooner rather than later!
reviews.title: Perfect for us (and our dog!)
Hot Summer Night Without Air Cond
reviews.text: It really comes down to price. In July I stayed in a larger, nicer room in Paris for 100 dollars less a night. Conferdation wanted 240 for a room with a view of the street.
The rooms were fine but the elevator had ratty old carpet in it. If the hotel was 130 a night, I would say fine, great, enjoy. At anything more than that, this place is way overpriced.
reviews.title: Acceptable standard accommodations
Not Bad, Not Great
reviews.text: I was at the hotel recently for a conference and banquet. The rooms are nice but not too comfortable. It was hard to find a place near the table/desk that I could plug my laptop power supply in. Bathroom toiletries were minimal.

Lobby was OK, the jazz bar off the lobby was reasonable but the other dining area was in need of a retrofit. The place looks like it was converted from a bar into something that is now geared to eating.
reviews.title: Friendly - but just OK

likes.liked: — Location right in the middle of downtown!

reviews.title: LOVED the "King CityView" Suite!!
reviews.text: Waterfront location is very nice. My room on the 5th floor had a waterfront view. The window opens so you are not forced to run the A/C all night if you don't want to.
If I had a choice, I'd likely pick a different place to stay in Kingston the next time.
reviews.title: Can't Wait To Go Back!!!!

likes.liked: — The location and how clean my room was.
likes.disliked: — No indoor pool, only a hot tub.

reviews.text: My wife and 2 kids (14 and 10) stayed at the Confederation for 1 night as we traveled from Mont Tremblant to Niagara Falls. The check-in was easy - the front desk staff friendly and helpful. The room was quite average - dated wall paper, older looking furnishings, etc. - nothing aweful or special - for $129 a night, you barely get what you pay for. We chose this place as it is one of the only hotels in town that accepts pets (we were travelling with a small dog). It was a fine stop-over.
reviews.title: Stay Away!

likes.liked: — I emerged alive - that's the only good thing I can say about the hotel
likes.disliked: — The extremely poor quality of the room and the incredibly bad value for money
